## Building Organizational Resilience

Our digital resilience solutions strengthen your organization's ability to withstand, adapt to, and rapidly recover from disruptions, ensuring continuity of critical business operations in the face of cyber threats and technical failures.

::: {.row .mt-4}
::: {.col-md-6}
::: {.security-feature}
### Business Continuity Planning

Comprehensive strategies to maintain essential functions during and after security incidents or system failures.

#### Key Benefits:
- Minimized operational downtime
- Protection of critical business processes
- Clear recovery priorities and procedures
- Resilient organizational structure

### Recovery Time & Point Objectives

```{=html}
<div class="row mt-4">
  <div class="col-md-12">
    <div class="card mb-4">
      <div class="card-body">
        <div class="row">
          <div class="col-md-6">
            <h3><i class="bi bi-clock-history text-primary"></i> Recovery Time Objective (RTO)</h3>
            <p>We help you establish and meet appropriate RTOs for different systems and data, determining how quickly systems need to be restored after a disruption.</p>
            <ul>
              <li>Critical systems: Minutes to hours</li>
              <li>Important systems: Hours to one day</li>
              <li>Non-critical systems: Days</li>
            </ul>
          </div>
          <div class="col-md-6">
            <h3><i class="bi bi-arrow-counterclockwise text-primary"></i> Recovery Point Objective (RPO)</h3>
            <p>We design backup strategies to meet RPOs, determining how much data loss is acceptable in the event of a disruption.</p>
            <ul>
              <li>Critical data: Near-zero data loss</li>
              <li>Important data: Hours of data loss</li>
              <li>Non-critical data: Day(s) of data loss</li>
            </ul>
          </div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
  </div>
</div>
```

### Zero-Trust Architecture

```{=html}
<div class="row mt-4">
  <div class="col-md-12">
    <div class="card mb-4">
      <div class="card-header bg-success text-white">
        <h3 class="card-title mb-0">Zero-Trust Security Principles</h3>
      </div>
      <div class="card-body">
        <div class="row">
          <div class="col-md-6">
            <h4><i class="bi bi-shield-lock text-primary"></i> Never Trust, Always Verify</h4>
            <p>All users, devices, and applications must be authenticated and authorized, regardless of their network location.</p>
            
            <h4><i class="bi bi-door-closed text-primary"></i> Least Privilege Access</h4>
            <p>Users and systems are granted only the minimum access necessary to perform their functions.</p>
            
            <h4><i class="bi bi-eye text-primary"></i> Assume Breach</h4>
            <p>Security design assumes that breaches will occur and focuses on minimizing their impact.</p>
          </div>
          
          <div class="col-md-6">
            <h4><i class="bi bi-segmented-nav text-primary"></i> Micro-Segmentation</h4>
            <p>Network segmentation that limits lateral movement and contains security breaches.</p>
            
            <h4><i class="bi bi-file-earmark-lock2 text-primary"></i> Data-Centric Security</h4>
            <p>Protection focused on securing data rather than just network perimeters.</p>
            
            <h4><i class="bi bi-reception-4 text-primary"></i> Continuous Monitoring</h4>
            <p>Real-time visibility into all network traffic, user activities, and system behaviors.</p>
          </div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
  </div>
</div>
```

## Cyber Resilience Assessment {#resilience-assessment}

Our cyber resilience assessment services evaluate your organization's ability to maintain operations during and after cyber attacks or technical disruptions.

```{=html}
<div class="row mt-4">
  <div class="col-md-6">
    <div class="card mb-4">
      <div class="card-header bg-primary text-white">
        <h3 class="card-title mb-0">Assessment Areas</h3>
      </div>
      <div class="card-body">
        <ul>
          <li><strong>Governance & Risk Management:</strong> Evaluation of resilience policies, procedures, and oversight</li>
          <li><strong>Threat Intelligence & Awareness:</strong> Assessment of threat monitoring and analysis capabilities</li>
          <li><strong>Security Controls:</strong> Review of preventive, detective, and corrective controls</li>
          <li><strong>Response Capabilities:</strong> Evaluation of incident detection and response procedures</li>
          <li><strong>Recovery Mechanisms:</strong> Assessment of backup, restoration, and continuity capabilities</li>
          <li><strong>Supply Chain Resilience:</strong> Review of third-party risk management and continuity</li>
        </ul>
      </div>
    </div>
  </div>
  
  <div class="col-md-6">
    <div class="card mb-4">
      <div class="card-header bg-primary text-white">
        <h3 class="card-title mb-0">Assessment Methods</h3>
      </div>
      <div class="card-body">
        <ul>
          <li><strong>Documentation Review:</strong> Analysis of policies, procedures, and plans</li>
          <li><strong>Technical Testing:</strong> Evaluation of technical controls and security measures</li>
          <li><strong>Tabletop Exercises:</strong> Scenario-based simulations to test response procedures</li>
          <li><strong>Interviews:</strong> Discussions with key personnel about resilience awareness and capabilities</li>
          <li><strong>Gap Analysis:</strong> Comparison of current state with best practices and standards</li>
          <li><strong>Resilience Metrics:</strong> Quantitative measurements of resilience capabilities</li>
        </ul>
      </div>
    </div>
  </div>
</div>
```
